intro: Galium sudeticum, commonly known as the Polish bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Galium sudeticum is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain European habitats.
